subject.normal: [Issue 3602] Release locks of all commit targets, regardless of whether they contain committable changes.

headers.subject: [Issue 3602] Release locks of all commit targets, regardless of whether they contain committable changes.
headers.received: from localhost ([127.0.0.1]) by Mail Reader Service (JAMES SMTP Server 2.3.0) with SMTP ID 88 for <issues@subversion.tigris.org.mrs>; Mon, 22 Mar 2010 02:21:52 -0700 (PDT)
by sc157-tigr.sjc.collab.net (Postfix, from userid 5000) id 47C45FCC09F; Mon, 22 Mar 2010 02:21:52 -0700 (PDT)

body.para:
------- Additional comments from lonavera@tigris.org Mon Mar 22 02:21:51 -0700
2010 ------- Ok I understand the problem for now. I don't know that at least one file have to be modified for the commit to actually taken place and to get the other locks released.
But I still think this behavior is not perfect here. Is the optimization to don't contact the repository at all if no modifications taken place really useful here?
Thank you very much for you help

To unsubscribe from this discussion, e-mail:
[issues-unsubscribe@subversion.tigris.org].
